item.title: The End Of IT And Software Jobs 2023 | What Lies Ahead?
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
2023 Is The End Of IT And Software Jobs? As India's IT and software job market faces lots of changes, This article may help you to take proper future decisions

Lets Explore Some facts And Reports

Indian Data

  1. Domestic software firms have reduced their workforce by over 16 million employees by 2022, resulting in an annual salary savings of $100 billion.
  2. Out of the 16 million employees, 9 million were in low-skilled services and BPO roles. Among these, 3 million jobs are projected to be lost by 2022 due to Robotic Process Automation (RPA).
  3. According to a Bank of America report, the United States has witnessed a loss of nearly 2 million jobs due to RPA.
  4. Leading IT companies such as TCS, Infosys, Wipro, HCL, Tech Mahindra, and Cognizant are planning to reduce their workforce by 3 million jobs by 2023.

World Data

  1. A World Economic Forum report states that automation will displace 75 million jobs by 2022, but it will also generate 133 million new jobs worldwide. Therefore, AI will both destroy and create jobs.
  2. According to a Gartner report, job creation related to AI will result in the creation of 2 million net-new jobs by 2025.
  3. In another report published by the McKinsey Global Institute, it is projected that AI will create sufficient job opportunities to balance the offset caused by automation, as long as there is reasonably good economic growth.
  4. Oxford academics estimate that automation could potentially take over 47% of US jobs by the mid-2030s.

Reasons : The End Of IT And Software Jobs

The IT and software industry has long been considered a pillar of employment and innovation, but recent trends suggest a paradigm shift that could potentially redefine the future of these sectors. From the over-hiring during the COVID-19 pandemic to the impact of advanced AI systems like Bard and ChatGPT, along with increased automation and challenges faced by companies in acquiring clients, and the rise and fall of numerous startups, multiple factors are converging to reshape the job landscape in IT and software sectors.

1. Over Hiring in COVID-19

The outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic led to significant uncertainty across industries. Many IT and software companies faced unexpected surges in demand for digital products and services. To meet this demand, these companies embarked on aggressive hiring sprees. However, as the pandemic subsided and the market stabilized, the need for a massive workforce diminished. Consequently, companies began reevaluating their staffing requirements, leading to a potential surplus of IT and software professionals.

2. Failure of Higher Education Systems

Higher education systems play a vital role in preparing individuals for careers in IT and software. However, the rapid pace of technological advancements often renders traditional curricula outdated. As a result, graduates may find themselves lacking the necessary skills to meet the evolving demands of the industry. The failure of higher education systems to adapt quickly enough to changing requirements can lead to a workforce that is ill-equipped to face the challenges of the future.

3. AI Systems like Bard and ChatGPT

Artificial intelligence (AI) systems, such as Bard and ChatGPT, have made significant strides in natural language processing and generating human-like text. These advancements have the potential to automate tasks traditionally performed by IT and software professionals, including coding, debugging, and even customer support. The integration of such AI systems into workflows could reduce the need for human intervention, resulting in a decreased demand for certain job roles within the industry.

4. Lots Of Automation

Automation has been an ongoing trend in various industries, and IT and software sectors are no exception. The proliferation of automation tools and platforms enables repetitive tasks to be streamlined or eliminated altogether. While automation enhances efficiency and productivity, it can simultaneously render certain job positions obsolete. As businesses seek cost-effective solutions and improved efficiency, the demand for manual software development and maintenance roles may decline.

5. Companies Struggling to Acquire Clients

The competitive landscape of IT and software industries has become increasingly challenging. The rise of digital transformation and the influx of new market players, including startups, has created intense competition for clients. Established companies that once thrived on securing large projects may now face difficulty in acquiring clients due to increased options and changing client preferences. As a result, these companies may downsize their workforce or shift their focus to other sectors.

6. The Rise and Fall of Startups

The startup ecosystem has witnessed significant growth in recent years, with many ventures attempting to disrupt the IT and software sectors. While some startups succeed and contribute to industry innovation, others struggle to sustain their operations. Failed startups can lead to job losses and uncertainty for professionals working in these companies. Moreover, the consolidation of the industry through mergers and acquisitions by larger corporations may result in reduced job opportunities for IT and software professionals.

Conclusion: The convergence of multiple factors, including over-hiring during the pandemic, challenges in higher education systems, the advent of advanced AI systems, increased automation, client acquisition difficulties, and startup failures, is reshaping the landscape of IT and software jobs. While certain roles may decline, new opportunities are likely to emerge in emerging technologies, data analytics, cybersecurity, and other areas. Adaptability, continuous learning, and a focus on acquiring new skills will be crucial for professionals to navigate these changes

item.title: All About TCS Ignite In Hand Salary Deductions And Increments | BSC And BCA
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
In this article, you will learn all about the TCS Ignite In Hand Salary, salary deductions, and increments from joining to up to the third year. Understanding the salary structure Of TCS Ignite Role

About TCS Ignite Program

TCS Ignite is a program offered by TCS (Tata Consultancy Services) that aims to bridge the gap between science and software for BSc (Bachelor of Science) and BCA (Bachelor of Computer Applications) students. The program provides an opportunity for BSc and BCA graduates to obtain an MCA (Master of Computer Applications) degree and a salary while working at TCS.

To be selected for the TCS Ignite program, candidates need to excel in the TCS Smart Hiring Test, which is specifically designed for BSc and BCA candidates. Only the top performers in this test are chosen to participate in the TCS Ignite program, which offers them the opportunity to enhance their skills and pursue a rewarding career in the field of software development and technology.

Subscribe To Classic Technology

Why Tcs Ignite Is Better Then WIPRO WILP

if you are looking to pursue a job after completing BCA and also desire a master's degree, the TCS Ignite program can be an excellent choice for you. It offers the opportunity to obtain an MCA degree while gaining practical work experience and earning a salary at TCS.

While other programs like Wipro WILP may also offer an MTech (Master of Technology) degree, it seems that you have a personal preference for pursuing an MCA degree after BCA or BSc. In that case, TCS Ignite aligns with your preference and can be considered as the best option for you.

It's important to evaluate your own career goals and preferences when choosing a program, and TCS Ignite seems to provide a comprehensive package that combines academic advancement with job opportunities, making it a favorable choice for individuals like yourself who are interested in a career in software development.

First Year TCS Ignite In Hand Salary

In this scenario, when an employee joins a company, they are offered an annual salary of INR 179,000. After considering various deductions such as PF (Provident Fund), Professional Tax, ESIS (Employees' State Insurance Scheme), and Labour Welfare, the net monthly salary for the first year is In Hand INR 13,135.

Ratings And Increments

In TCS Ignite role, ratings play a significant role in determining the increment in salary. The ratings are categorized as A, B, and C, representing different levels of performance.

  1. A rating (Good): If an employee receives an A rating, they are considered to have performed well. In this case, the employee will receive a salary hike of 40,000 INR in their overall package. For example, if the employee's current package is 1.9 LPA (Lakh Per Annum), it will be increased to 2.3 LPA.
  2. B rating (Best): An employee who receives a B rating is recognized as having performed exceptionally well. In this scenario, the employee will receive a salary hike of 30,000 INR in their overall package. For instance, if the employee's current package is 1.9 LPA, it will be increased to 2.2 LPA.
  3. C rating (Bad): If an employee receives a C rating, it implies that their performance was not satisfactory. In such cases, TCS may choose to assign the employee to a desk job or transfer them to a different project.

These rating-based increments and actions are specific to the TCS Ignite role and may vary depending on the policies and practices of the organisation.

Second Year In Hand Salary - Explained With Payslip

For the second year, if an employee receives a B rating, their package will increase from 1.9 LPA to 2.2 LPA. Let's analyze the pay slip with a B rating to understand the monthly earnings, deductions, and the final in-hand salary.

Monthly Total Earnings: The pay slip indicates that the total earnings for the month are 18,388 rupees. These earnings include various components such as basic salary, allowances, incentives, etc.

Deductions: The pay slip shows that deductions amount to 1,583 rupees. Deductions typically include components like income tax, provident fund contributions, insurance premiums, and other statutory deductions.

In-Hand Salary: To calculate the in-hand salary, we subtract the deductions from the total earnings. In this case, the calculation would be as follows: In-Hand Salary = Total Earnings - Deductions = 18,388 - 1,583 = 16,805 rupees.

Therefore, with a B rating in the second year of the TCS Ignite role, the employee would receive an in-hand salary of 16,805 rupees. It's important to note that these figures are specific to the example provided and may vary depending on individual circumstances and company policies.

here is a table that explains the in-hand salary of a TCS Ignite employee with a B rating in the second year:

Third Year In Hand Salary - Explained With Payslip ( Band )

In the third year of the TCS Ignite role, if an employee receives a B rating again, their package will increase to around 2.4 LPA To 2.5 LPA. Let's analyze the salary structure at the year-end with a B rating to understand the monthly earnings, deductions, and the final in-hand salary.

Band Means : You Will Get Bonus from Company After Completing A Year

Monthly Total Earnings: The pay slip indicates that the total earnings for the month are 19,824 rupees. These earnings include various components such as basic salary, allowances, incentives, etc.

Deductions: The pay slip shows that deductions amount to 1,685 rupees. Deductions typically include components like income tax, provident fund contributions, insurance premiums, and other statutory deductions.

In-Hand Salary: To calculate the in-hand salary, we subtract the deductions from the total earnings. In this case, the calculation would be as follows: In-Hand Salary = Total Earnings - Deductions = 19,824 - 1,685 = 18,139 rupees.

Therefore, with a B rating in the third year of the TCS Ignite role, the employee would receive an in-hand salary of 18,139 rupees. It's important to note that these figures are specific to the example provided and may vary depending on individual circumstances and company policies.

item.title: How To Master ATS Based Resume - 5 Tips By Experts
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
Master ATS Based Resume In today's competitive job market, a well-crafted resume plays a pivotal role in capturing the attention of hiring managers and securing a coveted interview. Your resume serves as your professional introduction to potential employers, showcasing your skills, experience, and qualifications.

Master ATS Based Resume

1. Create One Page Resume

As a fresher, designing a one-page resume is highly recommended. With limited professional experience, a concise resume allows you to present the most relevant information succinctly. One page ensures that hiring managers and ATS systems can quickly scan through your qualifications, improving your chances of being shortlisted.

  1. Concise Presentation: A one-page resume compels you to be selective with the information you include. It forces you to prioritize the most relevant details, such as your education, skills, internships, and projects, which are crucial for securing an entry-level position.
  2. Time-Saving for Recruiters: Recruiters often have limited time to review each resume thoroughly. By presenting your qualifications on a single page, you make it easier for them to quickly assess your suitability for the role. It saves their time and increases the chances of your resume being reviewed in detail.
  3. Clear and Focused Message: With only one page to work with, you must craft your resume in a way that conveys a clear and focused message. This requires you to carefully tailor your content to align with the job requirements, ensuring that every piece of information supports your candidacy.
2. Use Relevant Keywords

ATS systems scan resumes for specific keywords related to the job requirements. Tailor your resume by incorporating relevant keywords from the job description. Use industry-specific terminology, skills, and qualifications to demonstrate your alignment with the desired profile.

  1. Align with Job Requirements: ATS systems are designed to identify candidates whose resumes closely match the job requirements. By incorporating relevant keywords, you demonstrate your alignment with the desired profile and increase your chances of getting shortlisted.
  2. Improve Visibility: ATS systems rank resumes based on keyword relevance. When your resume contains the right keywords, it is more likely to rank higher and be seen by hiring managers. This improves your visibility and increases your chances of being considered for an interview.
  3. Showcase Specific Skills and Experience: Keywords often reflect the specific skills, qualifications, and experience sought by employers. By using these keywords in your resume, you showcase your proficiency in those areas and highlight your suitability for the role.
3. Spelling Mistakes

Cross Check Spelling Mistakes: Spelling errors can undermine the professionalism and credibility of your resume. After you have completed the initial draft, dedicate time to carefully review the content and check for any spelling mistakes. Here's how you can cross check spelling errors

Use Spell Check Tools: Most word processing software and online platforms offer built-in spell check features. Utilize these tools to identify and correct spelling errors automatically. However, be cautious as they may not catch all mistakes, particularly if they involve correctly spelled but contextually incorrect words.
Read it Backward : Reading your resume backward is an unconventional yet effective technique for catching errors. Here's how you can do it:

  • Start at the end of your resume and read each word individually, moving backward through the document. This approach forces your brain to focus on individual words rather than the overall context.
  • By reversing the reading order, you disrupt the natural flow of the text, making it easier to spot errors that might have gone unnoticed when reading in a traditional manner.
4. Optimize Your Resume

Checking the job description and tailoring your skills section accordingly is an excellent strategy to increase your chances of getting shortlisted for specific job applications. Here's how you can incorporate this approach effectively:

  1. Analyse the Job Description: Carefully review the job description for the specific position you're applying to. Identify the key skills, qualifications, and experiences sought by the employer.
  2. Identify Relevant Skills: Based on the job description, make a list of skills that are directly relevant to the role. These could include technical skills, software proficiencies, industry-specific knowledge, or transferable skills such as communication, problem-solving, or teamwork.
  3. Prioritize Skills: Determine which skills from your list align most closely with the job requirements. Highlight those skills in your resume to ensure they receive attention from both ATS systems and hiring managers. Place these key skills prominently in the skills section or integrate them throughout your resume.
  4. Showcase Accomplishments: Instead of merely listing skills, demonstrate your proficiency by providing specific examples or achievements related to each skill. For instance, if the job description emphasises project management skills, mention a project you successfully managed and the results you achieved.
  5. Customize for Each Application: Tailor your skills section for each job application. Assess the job description and make necessary adjustments to highlight the most relevant skills that align with the specific position. This demonstrates your attention to detail and the effort you put into understanding the employer's needs.
  6. Be Honest and Genuine: While it's important to align your skills with the job requirements, ensure that you are honest and genuine about your abilities. Don't exaggerate or include skills you don't possess. Focus on the skills you genuinely possess and can confidently discuss in an interview.
5. Add Project Details

Including relevant projects in your resume can indeed play a significant role in showcasing your skills, experience, and abilities. Here's how you can effectively incorporate projects into your resume

  1. Identify Relevant Projects: Consider the projects you have completed during your education, internships, or personal endeavors that align with the job requirements. Select projects that demonstrate your relevant skills, problem-solving abilities, and industry knowledge.
  2. Describe Project Details: In your resume, provide a concise description of each project, highlighting its objective, your role, and the outcomes achieved. Include information such as project duration, team size (if applicable), and any challenges overcome.
  3. Focus on Achievements and Results: Emphasise the specific accomplishments, contributions, and results of each project. Quantify your achievements whenever possible. For example, mention the percentage improvement you achieved, the cost savings you generated, or the positive feedback received from stakeholders.

item.title: Why There Is No Jobs For IT Students? In 2023 | Detailed Case Study
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
No Jobs For IT Students - According to a recent Nasscom report, out of 15 lakh students graduating in India, only 2 lakh students secure jobs. This statistic reveals that a mere 7% of graduates find employment in core engineering fields, while 13% find roles in sales and marketing. It is worth noting that this data excludes Bsc and BCA colleges.

The report further highlights the rapid growth of engineering colleges in India. Over the past decade, the number of engineering colleges has risen from 1,511 to more than 3,500. In comparison, the number of prestigious IIT colleges has only increased from 7 to 23.

No Jobs For IT Students

Surprisingly, Many private engineering colleges are owned by political leaders who Don't Have Any Knowledge About Education And IT Field.

In another study conducted by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF), Found That Only 14% Of Top 100 Colleges Are Private Colleges Even There Are 3500+ Colleges Around The India.

However, the educational landscape is not without its challenges. The report sheds light on corruption allegations against AICTE, India's regulatory body for technical education. In 2019, several individuals associated with AICTE were arrested, highlighting the need for reforms within the organisation.

Management Seat & Worst Curriculum

One of the significant issues plaguing the Indian engineering education system is the prevalence of management seats and the quality of the curriculum. Let's delve deeper into this problem:

  1. Professors focused on payments: In some colleges, professors are primarily motivated by financial gains rather than a genuine passion for teaching and guiding students. This can lead to a lack of commitment and dedication to their role as educators. When professors prioritise personal financial benefits over imparting knowledge, it hampers the overall quality of education.
  2. Inadequate technical expertise: Another concerning aspect is the lack of technical expertise among professors. Many professors in engineering colleges are unable to demonstrate practical skills such as developing functional websites and applications. This deficiency undermines their ability to provide students with the necessary guidance and hands-on learning experiences required in today's digital era.
  3. High teacher-to-student ratio: The teacher-to-student ratio in many engineering colleges exceeds the recommended limit. Instead of the ideal ratio of 1:15, it often surpasses 1:45 or more. This large disparity puts a strain on the quality of education and inhibits effective student-teacher interactions. With such a high ratio, students may struggle to receive personalised attention and guidance from their professors.
  4. Companies offering training programs: To compensate for the shortcomings of college education, many companies have taken the initiative to provide training programs. These programs aim to bridge the gap between the skills acquired in college and the practical requirements of the industry. Even master's students sometimes need additional training to enhance their employability, indicating the inadequacy of the curriculum in preparing students for real-world challenges.

Compulsory attendance

  1. Compulsory attendance overshadowing skills: In many colleges, the emphasis on compulsory attendance takes precedence over developing practical skills and entrepreneurial mindsets. This practice can hinder the growth of students who possess innovative ideas and aspire to create their startups. The rigid attendance rules often neglect the importance of nurturing entrepreneurial talents and focusing on skill development.
  2. Lack of entrepreneurship-focused curriculum: The curriculum in most Indian colleges generally follows a traditional, theory-based approach, focusing more on academic knowledge rather than practical application. This lack of entrepreneurship-focused coursework inhibits students from gaining the necessary skills, knowledge, and mindset needed to embark on entrepreneurial ventures or excel in job roles that require a startup mindset.
  3. Limited exposure to real-world challenges: Students in many colleges experience limited exposure to real-world challenges and entrepreneurial experiences. The absence of opportunities to engage in practical projects, internships, or startup incubators restricts their ability to develop problem-solving skills, business acumen, and the ability to adapt to dynamic market environments.
  4. Need for a supportive ecosystem: To foster a startup culture, colleges must cultivate a supportive ecosystem that encourages entrepreneurship. This includes facilitating mentorship programs, hosting entrepreneurial events, inviting industry experts for guest lectures, and providing access to resources and funding opportunities. Such initiatives can help create an environment where students feel inspired and supported to pursue their entrepreneurial aspirations.

What Is Experts Opinion

  1. Dheeraj Sanghi's perspective: Dheeraj Sanghi, the former Dean of Academic Affairs at IIT Kanpur, aptly describes the situation as a bubble that has burst. His statement acknowledges the challenges faced by engineering graduates in securing placements. Out of 100 students in IIT, only 66 are successfully placed. This statistic underscores the growing disparity between the premier technical institutions and those affiliated with UGC and AICTE.
  2. Anand Krishnan's viewpoint: Anand Krishnan, the Chairman of IIT Kanpur, echoes Sanghi's sentiments by emphasising the need to address the overwhelming number of AICTE engineering colleges. He suggests that approximately 6 lakh seats need to be eliminated due to the low placement rates and declining quality of education. Krishnan further emphasises the importance of promoting non-technical education, such as BA, BCom, BBA, and MBA programs.
  3. Market saturation and quality concerns: The expansion of engineering colleges across the country has led to market saturation, where the demand for engineering graduates no longer matches the supply. As a result, many graduates struggle to find suitable employment opportunities. The decline in placement rates among UGC and AICTE-affiliated institutions raises concerns about the quality of education and the relevance of the curriculum in meeting industry needs.
  4. The case for promoting non-technical education: Given the current scenario, there is a growing need to promote non-technical education programs. BA, BCom, BBA, and MBA courses offer diverse skill sets and knowledge that can align with emerging job markets. These programs focus on developing critical thinking, communication, and managerial skills, which are increasingly sought after by employers across various sectors.

Modi's Fake Promises

  1. Reforms in regulatory bodies: The Modi Sarkar administration pledged to bring about substantial reforms in regulatory bodies like UGC and AICTE. However, there is a pressing need to follow through on these promises to ensure the delivery of high-quality education. Implementing better rules and protocols within these bodies is essential to enhance transparency, accountability, and overall effectiveness.
  2. Effective implementation of NEP: The National Education Policy (NEP) holds great potential for transforming the education system. However, the full implementation of NEP is yet to be realised. To achieve its objectives, the government needs to prioritise the timely and effective implementation of NEP's proposed reforms, including curriculum revamps, skill development initiatives, and pedagogical advancements.
  3. College closures due to low admissions: In the last five years, the Indian education landscape has witnessed the closure of around 550 colleges. The primary reason for these closures is the lack of admissions. This alarming trend highlights the urgent need to address the challenges faced by educational institutions, promote higher education enrollment, and ensure sustainable institutional viability.

item.title: TCS Hiring Types | Simply Explained | Classic Jobs
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
In this article, we will exploreÂ TCS Hiring TypesÂ the various hiring processes employed by TCS (Tata Consultancy Services) for different educational streams such as BSc, BCA, Engineering, and more. We will delve into the classic job roles offered by TCS and provide approximate salary packages associated with these positions. Whether you are a recent graduate or an experienced professional, understanding TCS's hiring methods will give you valuable insights into their recruitment practices and job opportunities. Let's discover the pathways to landing a job at one of the leading IT companies in the world.

TCS Hiring Types

BCA & BSC - Ignite, Explore, CBO

  1. TCS Ignite Role:
    • This role is designed for BSc and BCA graduates who are interested in pursuing an MCA (Master of Computer Applications) degree from Shastra University, sponsored by TCS.
    • Starting Package: Approximately 1.9 LPA (Lakh per annum).
    • Nature of Work: TCS Ignite trainees primarily focus on development-oriented fields within the IT industry. They are exposed to various programming languages, software development methodologies, and IT projects.
  2. Xplore Role:
    • The Xplore role is another option offered to BSc and BCA graduates by TCS.
    • Starting Package: Similar to the TCS Ignite role, with an approximate package of 1.9 LPA.
    • Nature of Work: In the Xplore role, trainees are involved in development support tasks. They may work closely with software developers and assist in tasks related to coding, testing, debugging, and troubleshooting.
  3. BPS - Business Process Services:
    • BPS stands for Business Process Services, which is a different type of role offered to BSc and BCA graduates by TCS.
    • Starting Package: The package for BPS is also around 1.9 LPA.
    • Nature of Work: In the BPS role, trainees are engaged in business process operations. This includes tasks related to data entry, transaction processing, customer support, and various operational processes based on client requirements.
  4. After NQT Exam Roles:
    • TCS conducts the National Qualifier Test (NQT), and after the exam, students may be assigned to various roles based on their performance and the company's requirements.
    • Nature of Work: These roles can vary widely and may not be directly related to the graduate's field of study. Some candidates might find these roles less satisfying or not aligned with their career aspirations.

Engineering Students

  1. CS Ninja Role:
    • Eligibility: BE and BTech students are eligible for the TCS Ninja role.
    • Starting Package: Approximately 3.2 LPA (Lakh per annum).
    • Nature of Work: TCS Ninja trainees perform similar development-oriented tasks as TCS Ignite students. They are involved in software development, coding, testing, and other related activities. However, Ninja trainees receive a higher starting package compared to Ignite trainees.
  2. Digital Role:
    • Eligibility: BE and BTech students are also eligible for the Digital role.
    • Starting Package: The salary for Digital role candidates ranges from 6 to 8 LPA (Lakh per annum).
    • Nature of Work: The Digital role is geared towards candidates who are interested in working with cutting-edge, trending technologies. Trainees in this role are purely developers who work on innovative and advanced technology projects. They may be involved in areas such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, cloud computing, data science, IoT (Internet of Things), and other emerging technologies.

Comparison:

  • While both the TCS Ninja role and the Digital role are open to BE and BTech students, they offer different salary packages and job responsibilities.
  • TCS Ninja trainees perform development work similar to TCS Ignite trainees but with a higher starting package of around 3.2 LPA.
  • On the other hand, candidates in the Digital role receive a significantly higher starting package ranging from 6 to 8 LPA. These trainees exclusively work on cutting-edge technologies, contributing to innovative projects in various tech domains.

Management Students 

  1. Sigma Hiring Drive:
    • The Sigma hiring drive is a specialized recruitment process conducted by TCS to attract BBA and MBA students interested in pursuing finance-related roles within the company.
    • This drive is tailored to identify and hire talent with strong financial acumen and skills to contribute to TCS's financial operations and projects.
  2. BBA Candidates:
    • Eligibility: BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) graduates are eligible to participate in the Sigma hiring drive.
    • Starting Package: BBA candidates who are selected through this drive receive a starting package of approximately 3 LPA (Lakh per annum).
    • Nature of Work: BBA candidates hired through Sigma are assigned finance-related roles that may involve tasks such as financial analysis, budgeting, financial reporting, and assisting in financial decision-making processes.
  3. MBA Candidates:
    • Eligibility: MBA (Master of Business Administration) graduates with a finance specialization are also eligible for the Sigma hiring drive.
    • Starting Package: MBA candidates selected through this drive are offered a starting package of around 5 LPA.
    • Nature of Work: MBA candidates hired under the Sigma drive are placed in finance-focused roles with more significant responsibilities and opportunities for growth. They may be involved in financial planning, strategic financial management, risk analysis, and other critical financial functions.

Comparison:

  • The Sigma hiring drive caters to both BBA and MBA students interested in pursuing finance-related careers at TCS.
  • BBA candidates are typically offered roles with entry-level financial responsibilities, while MBA candidates receive roles with higher responsibilities and corresponding higher starting packages.
  • The starting package for BBA students is approximately 3 LPA, whereas for MBA students, it is around 5 LPA, reflecting the higher educational qualifications and specialized knowledge of MBA graduates.

Diploma And Others

TCS National Qualifier Test (NQT) is a hiring process conducted for candidates from all educational backgrounds. Based on their test scores and subject knowledge, candidates are assigned job roles within TCS. However, these roles come with a starting package of 1.8 LPA, which some consider to be relatively low for the skills and qualifications required. The NQT has faced criticism for offering positions that are perceived as less valuable or less aligned with candidates' expertise.

item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
About Us - Welcome to ClassicJobs.in - Your Trusted Source for Job Updates and Career Guidance!

At ClassicJobs.in, we are committed to helping engineering, BCA students, and freshers with no experience navigate the challenging world of job opportunities and career growth. Our platform is an extension of the popular YouTube channel, "Classic Technology," owned and managed by Akash Jadhav.

About US - Who We Are

Akash Jadhav, the driving force behind Classic Technology, has a passion for empowering students and young professionals to achieve their career aspirations. With a deep understanding of the job market and the evolving IT trends, Akash recognized the need for a comprehensive platform that provides accurate and reliable job updates, coupled with insightful career guidance.

What We Offer

1. Trusted Job Updates: Staying updated with the latest job opportunities is crucial for any job seeker. ClassicJobs.in curates and delivers current and trusted job updates from the IT industry. We understand that your time is valuable, and our aim is to simplify your job search process by presenting you with relevant openings that align with your qualifications and interests.

2. Career Guidance for Freshers: Navigating the professional world as a fresher can be overwhelming. Our platform offers valuable insights and guidance to help you kickstart your career journey with confidence. We provide resources on resume building, interview preparation, soft skills development, and more, giving you the edge you need to succeed.

3. Recent IT Trends: The world of technology is constantly evolving, and staying informed about the latest IT trends is crucial for both job seekers and professionals. We keep you updated on emerging technologies, industry trends, and skills that are in demand, ensuring you're well-equipped for a competitive job market.

Connect with Us

We value your engagement and encourage you to connect with us through various channels:

  • YouTube Channel: You can find Akash Jadhav's insightful career guidance videos on our YouTube channel, "Classic Technology." Subscribe to stay informed and motivated.
  • Email: Got questions or suggestions? Feel free to reach out to us at Classicjobs.in@gmail.com. We're here to assist you on your journey to success.
  • Website: Explore our user-friendly website, ClassicJobs.in, where you can access a wealth of job updates, career advice, and IT trends. It's our commitment to provide you with a seamless experience as you navigate your career path.

ClassicJobs.in - Where Opportunities Meet Aspirations

We are dedicated to being your go-to resource for job updates, career guidance, and industry insights. ClassicJobs.in is more than a website; it's a service of Classic Technology, driven by a passion for helping students and freshers shape their professional future. Join us on this exciting journey towards career success and growth.

Thank you for choosing ClassicJobs.in!

Best Regards,

Akash Jadhav
Founder, ClassicJobs.in
Owner, Classic Technology

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: ojwjql
item.content:encoded:
At Classic Jobs, accessible from www.classicjobs.in, one of our main priorities is the privacy of our visitors. This Privacy Policy document contains types of information that is collected and recorded by Classic Jobs and how we use it.

If you have additional questions or require more information about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us.

This Privacy Policy applies only to our online activities and is valid for visitors to our website with regards to the information that they shared and/or collect in Classic Jobs. This policy is not applicable to any information collected offline or via channels other than this website.

Privacy Policy Consent

By using our website, you hereby consent to our Privacy Policy and agree to its terms.

Information we collect

The personal information that you are asked to provide, and the reasons why you are asked to provide it, will be made clear to you at the point we ask you to provide your personal information.

If you contact us directly, we may receive additional information about you such as your name, email address, phone number, the contents of the message and/or attachments you may send us, and any other information you may choose to provide.

When you register for an Account, we may ask for your contact information, including items such as name, company name, address, email address, and telephone number.

How we use your information

We use the information we collect in various ways, including to:

  • Provide, operate, and maintain our website
  • Improve, personalize, and expand our website
  • Understand and analyze how you use our website
  • Develop new products, services, features, and functionality
  • Communicate with you, either directly or through one of our partners, including for customer service, to provide you with updates and other information relating to the website, and for marketing and promotional purposes
  • Send you emails
  • Find and prevent fraud
Log Files

Classic Jobs follows a standard procedure of using log files. These files log visitors when they visit websites. All hosting companies do this and a part of hosting services' analytics. The information collected by log files include internet protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, Internet Service Provider (ISP), date and time stamp, referring/exit pages, and possibly the number of clicks. These are not linked to any information that is personally identifiable. The purpose of the information is for analyzing trends, administering the site, tracking users' movement on the website, and gathering demographic information.

Cookies and Web Beacons

Like any other website, Classic Jobs uses "cookies". These cookies are used to store information including visitors' preferences, and the pages on the website that the visitor accessed or visited. The information is used to optimize the users' experience by customizing our web page content based on visitors' browser type and/or other information.

Google DoubleClick DART Cookie

Google is one of a third-party vendor on our site. It also uses cookies, known as DART cookies, to serve ads to our site visitors based upon their visit to www.website.com and other sites on the internet. However, visitors may choose to decline the use of DART cookies by visiting the Google ad and content network Privacy Policy at the following URL â€“ https://policies.google.com/technologies/ads

Our Advertising Partners

Some of advertisers on our site may use cookies and web beacons. Our advertising partners are listed below. Each of our advertising partners has their own Privacy Policy for their policies on user data. For easier access, we hyperlinked to their Privacy Policies below.

  • Google https://policies.google.com/technologies/ads
Advertising Partners Privacy Policies

You may consult this list to find the Privacy Policy for each of the advertising partners of Classic Jobs.

Third-party ad servers or ad networks uses technologies like cookies, JavaScript, or Web Beacons that are used in their respective advertisements and links that appear on Classic Jobs, which are sent directly to users' browser. They automatically receive your IP address when this occurs. These technologies are used to measure the effectiveness of their advertising campaigns and/or to personalize the advertising content that you see on websites that you visit.

Note that Classic Jobs has no access to or control over these cookies that are used by third-party advertisers.

Third Party Privacy Policies

Classic Jobs Privacy Policy does not apply to other advertisers or websites. Thus, we are advising you to consult the respective Privacy Policies of these third-party ad servers for more detailed information. It may include their practices and instructions about how to opt-out of certain options.

You can choose to disable cookies through your individual browser options. To know more detailed information about cookie management with specific web browsers, it can be found at the browsers' respective websites.

CCPA Privacy Rights (Do Not Sell My Personal Information)

Under the CCPA, among other rights, California consumers have the right to:

Request that a business that collects a consumer's personal data disclose the categories and specific pieces of personal data that a business has collected about consumers.

Request that a business delete any personal data about the consumer that a business has collected.

Request that a business that sells a consumer's personal data, not sell the consumer's personal data.

If you make a request, we have one month to respond to you. If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us.

GDPR Data Protection Rights

We would like to make sure you are fully aware of all of your data protection rights. Every user is entitled to the following:

The right to access â€“ You have the right to request copies of your personal data. We may charge you a small fee for this service.

The right to rectification â€“ You have the right to request that we correct any information you believe is inaccurate. You also have the right to request that we complete the information you believe is incomplete.

The right to erasure â€“ You have the right to request that we erase your personal data, under certain conditions.

The right to restrict processing â€“ You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.

The right to object to processing â€“ You have the right to object to our processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.

The right to data portability â€“ You have the right to request that we transfer the data that we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.

If you make a request, we have one month to respond to you. If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us.

Children's Information

Another part of our priority is adding protection for children while using the internet. We encourage parents and guardians to observe, participate in, and/or monitor and guide their online activity.

Classic Jobs does not knowingly collect any Personal Identifiable Information from children under the age of 13. If you think that your child provided this kind of information on our website, we strongly encourage you to contact us immediately and we will do our best efforts to promptly remove such information from our records.

Contact Us

If you have any questions or suggestions about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us. classicjobs.in@gmail.com

item.title: Accenture Onboarding Update 2023 | Interview & Results | Check Now
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
Accenture Onboarding Update 2023 - We Have Done Survey On Classic Technology Youtube Channel According To The Survey We Will Discuss All The On Boarding Updates Form The Accenture With Screenshots.

Accenture Onboarding Update 2023
1. Interviewer Didn't Joined

If, for any reason, the designated interviewer is unable to attend the scheduled interview, Accenture swiftly takes charge to resolve the situation. As reported by the company's support and through email communication, Accenture commits to rescheduling the interview before the end of August.

Attached Screenshot For Your Reference scroll down

Lots Of Students Had Same Issue But As Per Accenture requirement they are sending results as of now we have to wait upto august end or in worst case scenarios upto sept 15 it will take.

2. Applied But Not Shortlisted
  1. Academic Criteria: Accenture values academic excellence, and one of the primary reasons an application might not be shortlisted is if the candidate's academic performance falls below the minimum threshold. To be considered for shortlisting, it's crucial to meet the academic percentage criteria, which typically requires a score of 65% or higher. This criterion ensures that candidates possess a solid foundation for the roles they are applying for.
  2. Cooling Period: Accenture maintains a fair application process by implementing a cooling period policy. If you've applied multiple times within a span of three months, you might not be eligible for shortlisting. This policy ensures that candidates refrain from overwhelming the system with multiple applications in a short period, allowing for a more balanced and equitable selection process.
  3. Application Accuracy: When filling out your application form, attention to detail is paramount. Mistakes or inaccuracies in your application can lead to non-shortlisting. It's essential to double-check all the information you provide, including your contact details, academic history, and work experience, to avoid any potential hindrances in the shortlisting process.

Attaching Screenshot For Reference

3. Assessment Slot Problem

Assessment Slot Selection Timeline

Upon successful application, Accenture promptly communicates the requirement to select your assessment slot. The company provides a specified window during which candidates must choose their slots. This timeline is crucial, as it ensures a streamlined assessment process for all applicants.

The Importance of Swift Slot Selection

Accenture's assessment slots are in high demand due to the competitive nature of their recruitment process. If candidates fail to select their slots within the stipulated time frame, the available slots can quickly fill up. As a result, candidates who delay in choosing their slots might find themselves without a suitable option.

Resolving Slot Availability Issues

Recognising the potential challenges, Accenture has a support system in place to address slot availability concerns. If you encounter a situation where the slots have been fully occupied by the time you attempt to choose, don't worry. You have the option to raise a ticket to Accenture's support team. By doing so, the company will resend you the slot selection mail, enabling you to make your choice even if the initial slots are no longer available.

Navigating Slot Selection Challenges

If you find yourself in a situation where you're unable to select a slot due to unavailability, the key is to act promptly. Raise a ticket to inform Accenture's support team of your predicament. This ensures that you're not left without an opportunity to select a slot that aligns with your schedule.

Screenshots Attached For Reference

4. Multiple Registration

Cooling Period Overview:

Accenture implements a cooling period to ensure a fair and equitable application process for all candidates. This policy prevents applicants from inundating the system with multiple registrations within a short span of time. The cooling period allows the company's selection process to function smoothly and gives each candidate a balanced opportunity.

Impact of Multiple Registrations:

If you repeatedly attempt to register after receiving a "Registration Already Done" message, you risk unintentionally prolonging the cooling period. Each additional registration can lead to an extension of the cooling period, ultimately delaying your chances of progressing further in the application process.

Avoiding Cooling Period Extension:

To ensure that your application process remains on track and in alignment with Accenture's guidelines, it's imperative not to register multiple times. If you encounter the "Registration Already Done" message, it indicates that your initial registration has been successfully received. Additional registrations are unnecessary and could lead to unintended consequences.

Reaching Out for Assistance:

If you're uncertain about the status of your registration or encounter any issues, it's recommended to reach out to Accenture's support team for clarification. They can provide insights into the status of your registration and guide you through the next steps without Extending the cooling period.

Job Updates Website

item.title: SAP Off Campus Drive 2023 | IT Services Consultant | Apply Now
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
SAP Off Campus Drive 2023 for individuals from the batch of 2022/2023. The drive is part of SAP's recruitment process. They are inviting candidates who have completed their Bachelor's degree in any discipline to apply for this opportunity. If you find this opportunity appealing, I recommend applying without delay.

SAP Off Campus Drive 2023 Details

Eligibility Criteria for SAP Off Campus Drive 2023

Criteria for Eligibility

  • Candidates must possess a Bachelor's degree or higher in any of the following fields: Computer Science, Engineering, Information Management, or a related area.
  • Having some familiarity with SAP Technologies and Products would be a significant advantage.
  • Exceptional written, spoken communication, and presentation skills are necessary for effectively conveying issues and concerns.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Proficiency with operating systems like Linux and Windows, along with a solid grasp of OS-level system administration concepts, is expected. Familiarity with Relational and In-Memory DBMS concepts is essential.
  • Practical experience with HANA and/or ASE is advantageous. Having a background in SAP technologies, especially in an SAP support or consulting setting, is beneficial.
  • Understanding the fundamentals of technical planning, implementation, configuration, and integration of SAP solutions, including tasks such as installations, migrations, upgrades, and operations in intricate environments, is considered an asset. Experience with major cloud platforms (Azure / AWS), virtualisation technologies, and cloud storage systems is valuable.
  • A sound comprehension of network principles is crucial, encompassing key aspects of WAN technologies, DNS configuration, Firewall / Port setup, NSGs, Routers, subnets, and their interconnected functions. Basic knowledge of network and virtual technologies, such as load-balancers and virtual machines, is appreciated.
  • Adopting a customer-centric mindset is pivotal, emphasising the highest standards of service quality, customer satisfaction, and accomplishment. The ability to comprehend customer business objectives and translate them into technical requisites and easily adaptable solutions that cater to their needs is vital.

ABOUT THE COMPANY

In 1972, a group of five colleagues embarked on a journey to introduce something innovative. This team went on to revolutionize enterprise software, fundamentally reshaping the landscape of business operations. Presently, as a frontrunner in enterprise application software, we have stayed true to our original vision. We're committed to crafting solutions that ignite innovation, promote inclusivity, and create opportunities for both our employees and customers worldwide, transcending borders and cultures.

SAP places significant value on an entrepreneurial mindset, encouraging creativity, and nurturing enduring relationships with our workforce. We acknowledge that a diverse and inclusive workforce enhances our competitiveness and offers opportunities for all. We are of the belief that our collective efforts can revolutionise industries, bolster economies, elevate societies, and sustain the environment. It's the meticulously managed businesses that truly enhance the world's functioning and enhance people's lives.

YOUR TEAM

One of SAP's major clients has initiated their transformation journey with "RISE with SAP" and entrusted SAP itself to transition their operations to cloud infrastructure. In line with this transformation, around 80 productive landscapes need to be migrated to Microsoft's (Azure) and Amazon's (AWS) infrastructure. Simultaneously, the customer is undergoing SAP S/4HANA transformation, aiming to become a fully Intelligent Enterprise.

To ensure optimum service and effectively manage the intricacies of this project, we are assembling a dedicated team within the Enterprise Cloud Services Region MEE. This team will work exclusively for this customer. The team's objective is to oversee and operate the entire SAP landscape of the customer while driving the adoption of innovative practices.

YOUR ROLE

We are in search of a Junior Technical Landscape Owner for a key strategic customer account. You will be part of a team of Technical Landscape Owners responsible for handling all SAP technology matters pertaining to this customer.

Apply Now

item.title: Moodys Off Campus Drive 2023 | Associate Software Engineer | Apply Now
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
Moodys Off Campus Drive 2023 for the batch of 2022/2023, inviting candidates to participate in their recruitment process. Those with a Bachelor's degree in any field are eligible to apply for this opportunity. If you find this opportunity intriguing, we encourage you to submit your application at your earliest convenience.

Moodys Off Campus Drive 2023 Details
Job Responsibilities:
  • Assist in the setup, configuration, and oversight of application environments. This could encompass tasks like software installation, database setup, and network configuration.
  • Monitor the performance of application environments to ensure smooth and efficient operations. This may entail reviewing system logs, tracking performance metrics, or employing monitoring tools.
  • Help identify and resolve any issues within the application environments. This could involve delving into error investigations, debugging problems, and collaborating with other teams to find solutions.
  • Support the deployment of applications and updates to the environments. This might encompass preparing the environment for deployment, coordinating with cross-functional teams, and troubleshooting any deployment glitches.
  • Document the setup, configuration changes, and adjustments made to the environments. This documentation is crucial for maintaining accurate records and for troubleshooting future challenges.
  • Keep communication lines open with other teams and stakeholders, sharing updates on environment status, encountered challenges, and planned enhancements.
  • Contribute to the enhancement of application environment management practices. This could involve proposing process, tool, or workflow improvements.
  • A significant responsibility will be dedicated to learning and honing skills in application environment management. This might involve hands-on training, participation in workshops, courses, or independent study.
  • Utilize effective communication and collaboration to oversee external vendors delivering services.
Qualifications:
  • Typically, a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field is a prerequisite.
  • Possessing 0-3 years of experience in IT, particularly in roles related to environment management, system administration, or IT operations, might be necessary.
  • Demonstrating problem analysis and solution development skills is vital. This could entail tackling technical issues or analyzing performance metrics.
  • Strong communication abilities are critical, as the position will likely involve interaction with diverse teams and stakeholders.
  • Effectively managing tasks, setting priorities, and meeting deadlines is of utmost importance in this role.
  • Showing a willingness to grasp new technologies and procedures often outweighs existing technical expertise.
About Moody's:

True leaders are in a perpetual state of learning. Within Moody's, you'll find a community of information architects, thinkers, creators, and dedicated problem solvers. This diverse array of perspectives collaborates harmoniously to elicit our finest achievements. We invite you to be a part of this collective journey. Let's move forward, together.

Moody's nurtures a culture of growth, where we hold in high esteem those candidates who possess the willingness to evolve. If you're enthusiastic about this opportunity but don't precisely meet every requirement, we encourage you to submit your application. You could be an ideal match for this role or other available positions.

Moody's stands as a worldwide integrated firm specializing in risk assessment, enabling enterprises to enhance their decision-making processes.

Within the realm of Moody's, we're taking tangible steps. We're actively recruiting a diverse spectrum of talent and granting equitable opportunities to underrepresented groups in their professional trajectories. We're providing education, empowerment, and elevation to our workforce, fostering an environment where each individual can authentically express themselves, achieve their utmost potential, and prosper holistically. For deeper insights into our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion initiatives, employee development schemes, and to peruse our annual DE&I Report, navigate to moodys.com/diversity.

Special Note

Moody's upholds the principle of providing equal opportunities to all prospective employees. Every eligible candidate will be evaluated for employment without any bias related to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, nationality, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, or any other trait safeguarded by legal provisions.

Individuals seeking roles within Moody's Corporation might be requested to divulge their holdings in securities, following the guidelines laid out in Moody's Securities Trading Policy and in alignment with the requirements of the specific position. Acceptance of employment hinges on adhering to this Policy, which encompasses the necessary adjustments in holdings if deemed necessary.

item.title: IBM Off Campus Drive 2023 | Associate Systems Engineer | Apply Now
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
IBM Off Campus Drive 2023 - IBM has planned to recruit individuals for the position of Associate System Engineer, and this opportunity is open for candidates with a background in B.E, B.Tech, M.E, M.Tech, MCA, or M.Sc. The comprehensive requirements for eligibility and the process to apply can be found in the sections below.

About Role - ASE

In the role of an Application Developer, you will play a crucial role in guiding IBM's path forward. This involves converting system specifications into tailored system designs and developments within a dynamic environment. The responsibility of propelling IBM's success rests on your shoulders, as you convert essential business requirements into programming code and push for inventive solutions. Your efforts will be the driving force behind both IBM and its international clientele, as you collaborate and merge code into large-scale business systems. You will have the opportunity to tap into the most current education, tools, and technologies, offering an endless career trajectory with the world's leading technology innovator. Join IBM to create a worldwide influence!

IBM Off Campus Drive 2023: 
Requirements for Eligibility:
  • Education: Candidates should possess a BE, BTech, ME, MTech, MSc, or MCA degree with a minimum of 60% aggregate or a CGPA of 6.0. The calculation of qualifying marks will involve adding up the attained marks and dividing by the total maximum marks achievable. This calculation will encompass all subjects, including optional or elective ones.
  • Field of Study: Eligible branches include Computer Science (CS), Information Technology (IT), Robotics, Information Science and Engineering (ISE), Electrical Engineering (EE), Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE), Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering (EIE), Applied Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering (AEIE), Electrical and Electronics Engineering (EEE), Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering (ETE), Mathematics, and Computing.
  • Backlogs: No ongoing or pending backlogs should be present.
  • Skills: Proficiency in programming, preferably using languages such as Java, Python, and Node.js, as well as a solid understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) concepts.
  • Competencies: Demonstrated expertise in problem-solving and effective communication.
  • Compensation: For candidates with a BE, BTech, ME, MTech, MSc, or MCA degree, the offered annual compensation is INR 4.50 lakh, along with a one-time settling allowance of INR 25000.

Selection Criteria (all stages lead to elimination):

  1. Coding Test (IBMCodeKnack-NQT)
  2. English Language Test
  3. Interview Rounds

Selection Procedure:

IBM conducts assessments that are immersive, interactive, and time-effective for our candidates. We value both our and your time, aiming to provide a comfortable environment where you can genuinely showcase your capabilities and what you can contribute to the role and IBM. Every phase of the process results in elimination of candidates who don't meet the required standards.

  1. Coding Test (IBM CodeKnack-NQT)

The coding evaluation, hosted on HackerRank, aids us in identifying proficient developers possessing the right skill set. This technical hiring platform enables us to comprehensively gauge potential developers' problem-solving abilities through pertinent coding challenges.

  1. English Language Evaluation

Conducted online, this assessment measures candidates' proficiency in the English language. In roughly 10 minutes, candidates answer a series of multiple-choice questions (MCQs) designed to assess their grasp of the English language.

  1. Interview(s)

During this stage, candidates will be evaluated based on various skills including technical presentation, communication, growth mindset, innovation, and adaptability.

About IBM

IBM's most remarkable creation is the individual known as an IBMer. We firmly believe that by applying intelligence, logic, and scientific knowledge, we can enhance not only businesses but also society and the overall human condition. This involves actualizing the potential of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy, benefiting our clients and collaborators globally.

Having consistently reinvented ourselves since 1911, we stand as not just one of the world's largest corporate entities, but also among the most significant employers in the technology and consulting sectors. Numerous Fortune 50 companies rely on the IBM Cloud to manage their operations.

At IBM, we take pride in our role as pioneers in the adoption of artificial intelligence, quantum computing, and blockchain technology. The time has come for you to join us on our expedition to become a responsible trailblazer in technology, fostering positive impact in the world.

Apply Now

item.title: Finastra Off Campus Drive 2023 | Associate Software Engineer | Apply Now
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
Finastra Off Campus Drive 2023 - Finastra Drive has announced an Off Campus Drive for individuals belonging to the batch of 2022/2023. This recruitment event is intended for candidates who hold a Bachelor's degree in any discipline. If you find this opportunity appealing, we encourage you to submit your application at your earliest convenience.

Finastra Off Campus Drive 2023

Finastra Off Campus Drive 2023 Eligibility Criteria:

  1. Proficiency in Monitoring & Alerting: Applicants should possess a solid understanding of monitoring and alerting processes. Adeptness in overseeing system performance and responding to alerts is essential.
  2. Industry Experience Preferred: While not mandatory, experience in the software, financial, or banking sector is advantageous. Familiarity with these industries demonstrates a candidate's contextual knowledge.
  3. Market Infrastructure Knowledge: Candidates with prior exposure to market infrastructures, such as SWIFT and/or SIX, Fed&Chips Services, are preferred. Understanding these frameworks showcases an applicant's grasp of industry-specific protocols.
  4. STP Engine Testing Expertise: Ideal candidates should have experience in testing Straight-Through Processing (STP) engines. This experience is especially valued if it's within the context of transaction banking or payments gateways.
  5. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Linux: Applicants should be proficient in using Microsoft Office applications and Linux operating systems. Competence in these tools is crucial for efficient workflow and collaboration.
  6. Effective Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills are necessary. Candidates must be capable of effectively conveying information and providing excellent customer service.
  7. Ability to Work Independently and Collaboratively: The role demands the ability to work autonomously or as part of a team. Managing multiple projects concurrently is also expected.

Responsibilities

  1. Creation of Test Cases: The selected candidates will be responsible for developing comprehensive test cases based on product specifications. This ensures that all aspects of the software are thoroughly evaluated.
  2. Test Plan Execution: Successful applicants will execute test plans and test cases meticulously, recording and compiling results for analysis.
  3. Environment Setup: Candidates may need to set up and maintain their testing environments, and possibly extend this responsibility to team testing environments.
  4. Process Review: Collaborating with software development teams, candidates will contribute to improving product quality by evaluating and refining software development processes.
  5. Defect Tracking and Resolution: The role includes tracking defects from identification to resolution. Close collaboration with developers is required to reproduce and resolve any identified defects.
  6. Stakeholder Communication: Clear communication with stakeholders regarding product-related issues is vital. Candidates should adeptly manage communications to ensure seamless collaboration.
  7. Product Knowledge Acquisition: A continuous process of acquiring and maintaining knowledge about existing products, operations, or systems is expected.
  8. Documentation Review: Ensuring the accuracy and completeness of product documentation is part of the role's responsibilities.
  9. Pre-Release Support: Providing support to stakeholders prior to the software's release is essential for a smooth product launch.

In conclusion, the Finastra Off Campus Drive 2023 seeks candidates with a blend of technical expertise, industry knowledge, communication skills, and the ability to contribute to various stages of software development and testing. If you meet these criteria and are eager to be part of Finastra's dynamic team, we encourage you to apply and potentially secure a rewarding career opportunity.

In Short

What will you contribute?

  • Critical support to Development tools, applications and infrastructure.
  • Knowledge to the Development tools.

Responsibilities & Deliverables:

  • Support on development tools to internal customers

About Finastra

Finastra, headquartered in London, UK, is a prominent player in the financial software sector. The organisation provides an array of products and solutions catering to retail banking, transaction banking, lending, and the treasury capital markets.

item.title: Accenture Off Campus Drive 2023 | Freshers Can Apply
item.dc:creator: Akash Jadhav
item.content:encoded:
Accenture Off Campus Drive 2023, targeting the recruitment of candidates for the SASA role. This opportunity is open to individuals from a diverse range of three-year degree streams, including BSC, BCA, BBA, BA, and BCom. The drive aims to hire aspiring candidates for the positions of Associate Software Engineer and System and Application Services Associate. This recruitment initiative is extended to graduates holding degrees in B.E, B.Tech, M.E, M.Tech, MCA, and M.Sc. More comprehensive information regarding the Accenture off-campus drive can be found below.

Accenture Off Campus Drive 2023 For ASE Role

Overview of the Role

Become a part of our group dedicated to the advancement, conception, and upkeep of technologies that enhance the operational landscape for our clients and the global community. Engage with dexterity in intricate and ever-changing settings, employing your adaptability to shape and bolster technological resolutions, aligning with client needs spanning from assessment to execution.

Role Synopsis

Come aboard our unit that is at the forefront of devising, shaping, and sustaining technologies that elevate the efficiency of our clients and the world at large. Thrive in demanding and vibrant contexts, utilising your versatility to craft and provide support for technological remedies that fulfill client prerequisites, ranging from scrutiny to implementation.

Responsibilities in the Role
  • Formulating, constructing, validating, compiling, providing assistance, and setting up applications in accordance with business prerequisites.
  • Grasp the business catalysts that could influence performance and provide software that aligns with those anticipations.
  • Incorporate contemporary technological tendencies into resolutions; Engage in the creation of automated remedies, novel features, and cutting-edge technologies, amalgamating them into current solutions.
  • Accountable for addressing incidents and extending customer support via vocal interactions, electronic correspondence, online conversations, and remote assistance.
What we need?
  • Capable of foreseeing and efficiently resolving business challenges with agility.
  • Possessing versatility across various disciplines and adaptable with a knack for swiftly acquiring and applying new proficiencies.
  • Exhibiting adeptness in analytical and critical-thinking abilities, along with mastery in verbal and communicative aptitude.
  • Timely and precisely delivering code while adhering to quality standards, actively participating in collaborative evaluations by peers.
  • Assuming accountability for the triumphant execution of proposed solutions.
  • Providing assistance in managing infrastructure operations and/or overseeing the conveyance of IT production systems and services.
  • Being open to relocation as needed for project assignments across different regions of India and being willing to work round the clock in alignment with business requisites.

Apply Link ( ASE Role )

Accenture Off Campus Drive 2023 For SASA Role

Your Responsibilities

Application and Cloud Engineering

  • Identifying and resolving challenges within applications and infrastructure.
  • Leading the resolution of functional, technical, and infrastructure-related issues for clients.
  • Guiding clients, ranging from users to administrators and developers, in surmounting technological obstacles.
  • Emphasizing the enhancement of automation, self-service capabilities, and the evolution of cloud-based infrastructure environments.

Project Management Services

  • Facilitating program management and enhancing the overall quality of Technology Delivery.
  • Assisting projects within Technology Delivery Centers by monitoring and overseeing project management office tasks.
  • Actively monitoring, managing, and reporting on the execution of deliverables, while addressing any issues that arise.
  • Coordinating with multiple stakeholders to align priorities and objectives.

Low/No Code Application Development

  • Creating applications through a low-code development platform, configuring systems to match each client's unique needs.
  • Utilizing three essential components: form builders, pre-designed templates, drag-and-drop visual interfaces, and entity builders.
  • Conducting research and analysis of internal business processes, with the goal of streamlining and automating them.

Eligibility Criteria For Both The Roles

For ASE Role

Candidates from all fields/disciplines of B.E/B.Tech/M.E/M.Tech, MCA, and M.Sc. (Computer Science and Information Technology only), who have graduated in the years 2022 and 2023 with full-time educational commitments (Part-time and distance education will not be taken into account).

For SASA Role

Candidates from all academic disciplines including B.Sc., BCA, BBA, B.A, B.Com, B.Voc, BMS, B.B.S, B.F.M, B.B.I, B.A.F, B.Ed., B.M.M., B.FA, B.S.Micr, B. Design, M.C.M, M.Sc (excluding Computer Science and IT), M.A, M.Com, or M.FA, who have graduated in the years 2022 and 2023 with dedicated full-time educational commitments (Part-time and distance education will not be taken into consideration).

Please take note that individuals with a background in BE/ BTECH / ME / MTECH/MCA/ MSC (CS and IT Branch) MBA /PGDBM are not eligible to apply for this position.

Furthermore, there should be no ongoing backlogs during the application process or upon onboarding.
